thread.title: St Etienne boss insists Manchester United tie in Europa League are "least important" of the month
thread.title_full: St Etienne boss insists Manchester United tie in Europa League are "least important" of the month

author: mirror
title: St Etienne boss insists Manchester United tie in Europa League are "least important" of the month
text:
Sport St Etienne boss insists Manchester United tie in Europa League are "least important" of the month United face the Ligue 1 side in the last 32 of the competition but Christophe Galtier has played down the significance of the upcoming two legs Share St Etienne coach Christophe Galtier (Photo: Getty) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
St Etienne manager Christophe Galtier has played down the importance of his side's clashes with Manchester United. 
United have been drawn with the Ligue 1 side in the last 32 of the Europa League. 
The first leg is set for Old Trafford on February 16 before the reverse the following week. 
But with his side looking to qualify for the Champions League domestically, Galtier insists the clash is the least important of the month, reports the Manchester Evening News. 
St Etienne are fifth in the French League, one point behind rivals Lyon. St. Etienne's players react after scoring (Photo: REUTERS) Juan Mata celebrates scoring Manchester United's third goal at Leicester (Photo: PA) 
St Etienne boss Galtier said: "There can be no relaxation, I do not fear that, even if we have to think about it. 
"The most important matches will obviously be next, Nice, and Lorient. 
"And the two games with Manchester will surely be the two least important matches of the month of February. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
